nodes.bodyText:
We should at least add something to the javadoc of serviceName() to say that's it's the namespace-local name.
And we should consider deprecating it and adding a new localServiceName() method instead to make the distinction more obvious.

Adding it to the Javadoc is fine. I'm not sure I like the idea of deprecating it and adding another method:

The serviceName is used in all of our resources with a service in the same meaning
serviceName is actually what it does, it returns the name of the service which is without any namespace or qualifiers. So I think semantically it does exactly how it is named.
